title: Introduction to OMEAPI
text: OME requires get API token, alphanumeric string need send every request. need contact OME data manager create token . Keep token private. can pass token function via token parameter, ’s better store token either environment variable (OME_CS_TOKEN). set longer need pass token individual functions. wil persist session ended.

title: Introduction to OMEAPI
text: Query survey information (e.g., cs_surveys() cs_surveys_responses()) Query school (class, pupil, teacher, parent) information (e.g., cs_schools()) Query meta-information (e.g., cs_school_types(), cs_person_types(), cs_response_value_groups(), cs_response_types(), etc)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jake Powell. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Powell J (2026). OMEAPI: API wrapper cohort study database. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/Jake-Powell/OMEAPI.
code: @Manual{,   title = {OMEAPI: API wrapper for cohort study database},   author = {Jake Powell},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/Jake-Powell/OMEAPI}, }

what: API wrapper for cohort study database
title: API wrapper for cohort study database
text: OMEAPI package used query maths cohort studies database create basic analysis graphs extracted information. functions within package cover endpoints cohort studies API. use package requires API token use. information obtain API key please contact mathsobservatory@nottingham.ac.uk.

title: API wrapper for cohort study database
API wrapper for cohort study database
text: example work need API token can set set_token().
code: library(OMEAPI)  # Get all surveys surveys = cs_surveys()  # load responses for a particular survey. survey_response = cs_surveys_responses(id = surveys$id[1] |> as.numeric())

title: Query meta-information endpoints — cs_academic_years
text: collection functions query "meta-information" Cohort Studies API.

title: Query meta-information endpoints — cs_academic_years
code: cs_academic_years(token = NULL)  cs_school_years(token = NULL)  cs_response_types(token = NULL)  cs_response_value_groups(token = NULL)  cs_person_types(token = NULL)  cs_cohorts(token = NULL)  cs_school_types(token = NULL)

title: Query meta-information endpoints — cs_academic_years
text: token API token

title: Query meta-information endpoints — cs_academic_years
text: Query result data frame.

title: Query meta-information endpoints — cs_academic_years
text: Query specific meta-information endpoints Cohort Studies database, particular: cs_academic_years(): queries /api/Public/academic-years endpoint. cs_school_years(): queries /api/Public/school-years endpoint. cs_response_types(): queries /api/Public/response-types endpoint. cs_response_value_groups(): queries /api/Public/response-value-groups endpoint. cs_person_types(): queries /api/Public/person-types endpoint. cs_cohorts(): queries /api/Public/cohorts endpoint. cs_school_types(): queries /api/Public/school-types endpoint. function uses get_query()  query specific endpoints.

title: Query meta-information endpoints — cs_academic_years
code: if (FALSE) { # Setup API token set_token('ENTER_TOKEN_HERE')  # Query each endpoint academic_years = cs_academic_years() school_years = cs_school_years() response_types = cs_response_types() response_value_groups = cs_response_value_groups() person_types = cs_person_types() cohorts = cs_cohorts() school_types = cs_school_types() }

title: Query school endpoints — cs_schools
text: functions query school-related information Cohort Studies API.

title: Query school endpoints — cs_schools
code: cs_schools(token = NULL, id = NA, include = NA, flatten = F, ...)

title: Query school endpoints — cs_schools
text: token API token id school ID CS database. NA, schools pulled. include Character vector objects include. Accepted values : 'class', 'student', 'teacher'. flatten flag (TRUE/FALSE) whether convert flat data.frame. ... variables passed get_query().

title: Query school endpoints — cs_schools
text: data.frame pulled information

title: Query school endpoints — cs_schools
text: Queries /api/Public/schools /api/Public/schools/{id} endpoints. Note schools structured classes nested within schools teachers/students nested within classes. Therefore, include "student" /"teacher" must also "class" include parameter. default returned data.frame can nested data.frames (within student, etc). switching `flatten = T` returned data frame can flattened (converted long format) remove nested structure.

title: Query school endpoints — cs_schools
code: if (FALSE) { # Setup API token set_token('ENTER_TOKEN_HERE')  # Query all schools. schools = cs_schools()  # Query schools with all include options. schools_with_details = cs_schools(include = c('class', 'student', 'teacher'))  # Query schools with only student include option # (note that without class this is the same as including no options). schools_with_details = cs_schools(include = c('student'))  # Query a single school estab_number = schools$establishmentNumber[1] |> as.numeric() school = cs_schools(id = estab_number,  include = c('class', 'student', 'teacher'))  # Query a single school where we flattern the student/teacher information. school_flat = cs_schools(id = estab_number,   include = c('class', 'student', 'teacher'),    flatten = T) }

title: Query survey endpoints — cs_surveys
text: Query survey endpoints

title: Query survey endpoints — cs_surveys
code: cs_surveys(token = NULL, id = NA)  cs_surveys_responses(   token = NULL,   id = NA,   respondentIds = "",   teacherIds = "",   schoolIds = "",   classIds = "",   output_type = "wide",   verbose = F )

title: Query survey endpoints — cs_surveys
text: token token id survey ID CS database. NA, surveys pulled. respondentIds verbose teacherIds verbose schoolIds verbose classIds verbose output_type output_type verbose verbose

title: Query survey endpoints — cs_surveys
text: data.frame pulled information

what: Helper to get and save OME API token — cs_use_token
title: Helper to get and save OME API token — cs_use_token
text: Provides instructions obtain store API token OME API. Users must complete step using functionality requires authentication. Obtaining token requires contacting OME team via email.

title: Helper to get and save OME API token — cs_use_token
Helper to get and save OME API token — cs_use_token
text: requesting access, receive API token email. received, token stored .Renviron file name OME_CS_TOKEN R must restarted change take effect.

title: Helper to get and save OME API token — cs_use_token
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Display instructions to set up an OME API token cs_use_token() } # }

what: flatten a data frame with (multiple) list elements — flatten_df
title: flatten a data frame with (multiple) list elements — flatten_df
text: flatten data frame (multiple) list elements

title: flatten a data frame with (multiple) list elements — flatten_df
flatten a data frame with (multiple) list elements — flatten_df
text: df data frame

title: flatten a data frame with (multiple) list elements — flatten_df
text: flat data frame (long format)

what: General function for querying API endpoints — get_query
title: General function for querying API endpoints — get_query
text: General function querying API endpoints

title: General function for querying API endpoints — get_query
General function for querying API endpoints — get_query
text: url_path API endpoint filter Addition objects pass via include. token API token verbose Flag (TRUE/FALSE) console printing (used pagination).

title: General function for querying API endpoints — get_query
text: data frame pulled information

title: General function for querying API endpoints — get_query
text: function queries API endpoint given `url_path`. endpoint takes arguements can passed via `filter` input concatenates endpoint value supplied `filter.` bearer token passed using token input. Note function assumes API pagination (adds "?pageNumber=") loop available pages rbind result single data frame.

what: Set CS token to the environment. — set_token
title: Set CS token to the environment. — set_token
text: Set CS token environment.

title: Set CS token to the environment. — set_token
Set CS token to the environment. — set_token
text: token token

title: Set CS token to the environment. — set_token
text: Given CS token access CS database, store token local environment. means need pass token call API. Moreover, can set delete thus token display R files.

what: Convert 'flattened' survey to wide format. — survey_response_to_wide
title: Convert 'flattened' survey to wide format. — survey_response_to_wide
text: Convert 'flattened' survey wide format.

title: Convert 'flattened' survey to wide format. — survey_response_to_wide
Convert 'flattened' survey to wide format. — survey_response_to_wide
text: survey flattened survey.

title: Convert 'flattened' survey to wide format. — survey_response_to_wide
text: survey wide format.

title: Convert 'flattened' survey to wide format. — survey_response_to_wide
code: if (FALSE) { survey = cs_surveys_responses(id = 'ENTER_ID_HERE', output_type = 'original' ) survey_wide = survey_response_to_wide(survey) }

title: OMEAPI 0.1.0
text: development.
